intro: Veronica keniensis, commonly known as Kenyan speedwell, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. Veronica keniensis is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
